title: Do I need a will if I have absolutely no assets other than my Social Security check?
question: I have a few credit card debts and owe the IRS and State taxes which I inadvertently never paid when I inherited some money from my mom when she died. I have spent all the inheritance and am paying monthly to them.
answers: It looks like a Will would be pointless for you - although, at the time of your passing, who knows, you could have assets at that time, for some reason.
Under these facts a Will is unnesseary

Probably not unless you have specific things you want to leave to people, such as furniture, dishes, collectibles, a car, etc. If that is the case, you can hand write your wishes, sign and date them, and they should be carried out.
